Message.Title: YAHOO! Establishes True Work Accountability - GREAT News!
Message.Msg: Get real, folks! Yahoo! (via MM) is sending out a long-needed message: We hire you to do a job, and be productive at work. "Teleworking" is another term for working from home so you can watch your kids, take a nap, and work when you feel like it - all the while not interacting with fellow creative employees. Nonsense. Appreciate the opportunity to work, interact to be productive, and forget this entitlement-philosophy that an employer "owes you" time during working hours to watch your children, talk with friends, make a snack, take a nap, go to yoga, etc. Does anyone really think the productivity from competitors in China "work" from home? So the stock price dips. Once Yahoo! employees learn teamwork and mutual support at work, productivity will shoot up faster than you can say "YAHOO! hit $30 a share today!"

Message.Title: Getting Very Tired of Hearing About How Terrible a Decision..
Message.Msg: it was for Marissa to ban work at home. Look, unlike the clowns who have run this shop in the past Marissa is setting a clear course for success and one of the top priorities on that list is cleaning out the dead wood and belive me Yahoo! has accumulated more than its fair share of it over the years. This is a strategic move by MM to keep the cream and cut out the bozos who are holding Yahoo back and I am sure she has said as much to her A team. In the business Yahoo is in, success is based on creativity and collaboration and that is much more effective when people are co-located. I hope MM stands her ground on this and doesn't back down to the morons who have no idea what they are talking about calling this a terrible decision...

Message.Title: Why Apple Needs To Buy Yahoo Today
Message.Msg: Internet Services has received quite a bit of attention over the last few months on blogs and in the press and it deserves to. As the battle between mobile OS’s continues to heat up over the coming years, rolling out amazing Internet Services will become more important, not less. Apple is again taking a go slow and grind it out approach to these. MobileMe didn’t work. We’ll learn from that. Apple Maps didn’t work. We’ll learn from that. The thinking seems to be internally: we don’t need to be first to market with great services, we just need to get to market. Sadly though, consumers seem to be getting more and more impatient in waiting around for Apple. Google was never perfect out of the blocks with their Internet Services but they do seem to be on a roll lately. Apple does need more external talent with these skills injected into the organization. Yahoo (YHOO) could be a great fit and Marissa Mayer would be an ideal head of Apple mobile Internet Services. Mail, Flickr, and their core properties would fit very well into prominent positioning in iOS. As Mayer has been saying of late, the Yahoo properties map on very well to the top 10 list of activities of what people do most on mobile.

Topic.Title: YAHOO! Establishes True Work Accountability - GREAT News!

Message.Msg: Those who will quit and perhaps try to sue YAHOO! because they were expected to pay for gasoline and spend time in traffic to actually GO to an office and work with others will have little sympathy among the long-term unemployed. With today's unemployment and under-employment, Yahoo employees hould be grateful for the opportunities they have, not demanding.

Topic.Title: Remote Worker Productivity is a Myth

Message.Msg: The federal government is pushing "teleworking", and every time there's any snow, employees are told they have the choice to taking leave or "teleworking". The problem is the employees are not given specific assignments, and when they return to work, they discuss the soap operas they spent the day watching, or the shopping they did. No accountability; no consequences. Teleworking should be restricted to professions such as painters and writers, not people who work together to colaberate to produce new concepts and R&D. MM is setting standards, and I applaud her. Neither sex should claim special treatment because they have small children at home - that's discrimination. Nobody should complain about commuting; that's part of any job unless you're self-employed!

She is happy to have those since she is a divorced mom but would jump at the chance to go to these YHOO jobs. So much sympathy for the home-workers??? Could it be because so many are seeing this while they surf the net & watch TV while they sit home & collect a check. BTW this family member of mine qualified for collecting a check but said she couldn't just sit home & do that...4 years ago. Blessings :)

Message.Title: Sold today
Message.Msg: I bought at $11 and sold today. The reason I bought at 11 was because the company looked solid and grossly undervalued. There is tremendous value in keeping major design changes from happenning to the site. Familiarity, despite being boring, keeps users coming back. I didn't like the design changes they made. Next you get the work from home ban. I would suggest anyone who is for this look into a little principle called "loss aversion". I try to buy stocks in a company any idiot could run, but unfortunately, I think an idiot is now running YHOO. They would be better off with a robot that just bought back shares, and stayed out of the way.
